title: Why I am not a Calvinist
description:
#calvinism #philosophyofreligion #apologetics #predestination #christianity 
Hey everyone, in this video I'll explain why I am not a Calvinist by going through several philosophical arguments I've developed against it.  I doubt any of these are groundbreaking but I figured I'd make this video anyways because I am concerned Calvinism can lead to misconceiving God's nature in a problematic way.  Most of this video will discuss predestination and double predestination, but I'll also touch on other aspects of TULIP, such as Total Depravity and Unconditional Election.

Two YouTubers who are good candidates to clarify/respond:
@redeemed_zoomer 
@TruthUnites 

John MacArthur Clip: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=88WvD_Tvv_o&pp=ygUOcHJlZGVzdGluYXRpb24%3D

References:
[1] C. S. Lewis, Mere Christianity. Harper Collins, 2009.
[2] M. Webster, “Definition of Calvinism.” Accessed: Sep. 17, 2025. [Online]. Available: https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/Calvinism
[3] Crossway Bibles, Ed., ESV: study Bible: English standard version, ESV text ed. Wheaton, Ill: Crossway Bibles, 2007.
[4] J. Strong, The New Strong’s Expanded Exhaustive Concordance of the Bible: Every Word of the Bible Indexed, Red Letter Edition. Nashville: Thomas Nelson, 2010.
[5] E. H. Merrill, Haggai, Zechariah, Malachi: An Exegetical Commentary. S.l.: CreateSpace Independent Publishing Platform, 2014.
[6] P. A. Verhoef, The books of Haggai and Malachi, Eerdmans classic biblical commentaries edition. Grand Rapids, Michigan: William B. Eerdmans Publishing Company, 2018.
[7] J. Hayford, “Understanding God’s Purposes with Israel,” Jack Hayford Ministries. Accessed: Sep. 17, 2025. [Online]. Available: https://www.jackhayford.org/teaching/articles/understanding-gods-purposes-with-israel/
[8] “Biblehub,” Bible Hub, Expositor’s Bible Commentary, accessed August 20, 2018, https://biblehub.com/commentaries/expositors/genesis/1.html.

[10] Aristotle, Rhetoric. S.l.: CreateSpace Independent Publishing Platform, 2013.

[12] C. Church, Catechism of the Catholic Church. USCCB Publishing, 2000.
[13] A. Plantinga, God, Freedom, and Evil. Wm. B. Eerdmans Publishing, 1977.

title: The Ignorance of Igtheism
description:
#christianity #philosophy #philosophyofreligion #epistemology 

In this video, I'll explain why igtheism/ignosticism is an ignorant position to hold.  Note that I am using the term "ignorant" quite literally, not in a pejorative sense.

References:
[1] I. S. T. the N. Y. Times, “Jewish ‘Ignostic’ Stirs Convention; Dropping of ‘God’ in Service Deplored and Condoned,” The New York Times, Jun. 20, 1965. Accessed: Oct. 08, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://www.nytimes.com/1965/06/20/archives/jewish-ignostic-stirs-convention-dropping-of-god-in-service.html
[2] “Sherwin Wine,” Wikipedia. Sep. 23, 2024. Accessed: Oct. 08, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Sherwin_Wine&oldid=1247288370
[3] “Ignosticism,” RationalWiki. Accessed: Oct. 10, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://rationalwiki.org/wiki/Ignosticism

[5] E. Green, “On Igtheism,” Emerson Green. Accessed: Oct. 08, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://emersongreenblog.wordpress.com/2020/05/28/on-igtheism/
[6] T. Aquinas, Summa Theologica. R. & T. Washbourne, 1922.

title: Christian Arguments For and Against Gay Marriage
description:
#christian #apologetics #debate 
In this video, I'll lay out the Christian arguments for and against Gay marriage.  Unfortunately this debate is often accompanied by name calling and other unhelpful rhetoric that generates more heat than light.  My goal here is not to try and convince you one side is correct, but rather to lay out the arguments on each side.

References:
[1] J. D. Hunter, Culture Wars: The Struggle To Control The Family, Art, Education, Law, And Politics In America. Basic Books, 1992.
[2] Crossway Bibles, Ed., ESV: study Bible: English standard version, ESV text ed. Wheaton, Ill: Crossway Bibles, 2007.
[3] Tertullian - On Repentance
[4] A. MacIntyre, After Virtue. A&C Black, 2013.
[5] V. Paul, Humanae vitae. na, 1968.
[6] R. I. Krasner, The Microbial Challenge: Science, Disease, and Public Heatlh. Jones & Bartlett Publishers, 2009.
[7] S. Mowbray, “Deadly Diseases That Plagued People in Ancient Times are Similar to Those of Today,” Discover Magazine, Mar. 07, 2024. Accessed: Oct. 16, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://www.discovermagazine.com/the-sciences/deadly-diseases-that-plagued-people-in-ancient-times-are-similar-to-those-of
[8] B. Pickett, “Homosexuality,” in The Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy, Spring 2021., E. N. Zalta, Ed., Metaphysics Research Lab, Stanford University, 2021. Accessed: Oct. 15, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://plato.stanford.edu/archives/spr2021/entries/homosexuality/

title: Hume's Fallacy: Probability, Frequency, and Miracles
description:
#philosophy #apologetics #davidhume #christian #philosophyofreligion 

In this video, I'll explain the central fallacy in David Hume's argument against miracles in Section X of his Enquiry Concenring Human Understanding.

Here is a video I made explaining the difference between Bayesian and Frequentist views on probability: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mWaRlVEIoDM

References:
[1] S. C. Meyer, Return of the God Hypothesis: Three Scientific Discoveries That Reveal the Mind Behind the Universe. HarperCollins, 2021.
[2] C. Taylor, A Secular Age. Harvard University Press, 2009. doi: 10.4159/9780674044289.
[3] A. Clayton, Bernoulli’s Fallacy: Statistical Illogic and the Crisis of Modern Science. Columbia University Press, 2021.
[4] N. L. Geisler, “4. Miracles & The Modern Mind,” in In Defense of Miracles: A Comprehensive Case for God’s Action in History, InterVarsity Press, 2014.
[5] A. Flew and R. A. Varghese, There Is a God: How the World’s Most Notorious Atheist Changed His Mind. Harper Collins, 2009.
[6] J. Earman, Hume’s Abject Failure: The Argument Against Miracles. Oxford University Press, 2000.
[7] A. N. Kolmogorov and A. T. Bharucha-Reid, Foundations of the Theory of Probability: Second English Edition. Courier Dover Publications, 2018.
[8] D. Hume and E. Steinberg, An Enquiry Concerning Human Understanding, 2. ed. Indianapolis: Hackett, 1993.
[9] B. De Finetti, A. Machì, A. F. M. Smith, and B. De Finetti, Theory of Probability: A Critical Introductory Treatment. Chichester, UK ; Hoboken, NJ: John Wiley & Sons, 2017.
[10] T. Kelly, “Evidence,” in The Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy, Winter 2016., E. N. Zalta, Ed., Metaphysics Research Lab, Stanford University, 2016. Accessed: Feb. 16, 2025. [Online]. Available: https://plato.stanford.edu/archives/win2016/entries/evidence/
[11] W. Adams, An Essay in Answer to Mr. Hume’s Essay on Miracles., 3d ed. London: White, 1767.
[12] C. Babbage, The Ninth Bridgewater Treatise. A fragment ... Second edition. Lea & Blanchard, 1841.
[13] M. Truzzi, “Zetetic Ruminatrons on Skepticism and Anomalies in Science,” Citeseer, vol. 12–13, pp. 7–21, 1987.
[14] P. Millican, “Hume, Miracles, and Probabilities: Meeting Earman’s Challenge,” 2003.
[15] R. Price, Four Dissertations. T. Cadell, 1777.
[16] Habermas, Gary R., and Mike Licona. The Case for the Resurrection of Jesus. Grand Rapids, MI: Kregel Publications, 2004.

title: The Euthyphro Dilemma
description:
In this video, I'll talk about the Euthyphro dilemma and why I do not see it as a serious challenge to Christian theism or theism in general.  Thank@TheologicalDissent for the video idea.

References:
[1] Plato. Euthyphro. Translated by Benjamin Jowett. Independently published, 2020.
[2] G. W. Leibniz, “Reflections on the Common Concept of Justice,” in Philosophical Papers and Letters, G. W. Leibniz and L. E. Loemker, Eds., Dordrecht: Springer Netherlands, 1989, pp. 561–573. doi: 10.1007/978-94-010-1426-7_60.
[3] Plato, The Republic. CreateSpace Independent Publishing Platform, 2021.
[4] Plato and B. Jowett, Apology. Independently published, 2020.
[5] Plato, Laws. Independently published, 2020.
[6] H. Chadwick, Early Christian thought and the classical tradition: studies in Justin, Clement and Origen, 1. issued as an academic paperback, Reprint. Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1987.
[7] W. Morriston, “Must There Be a Standard of Moral Goodness Apart from God?,” Philosophia Christi, vol. 3, no. 1, pp. 127–138, Apr. 2001, doi: 10.5840/pc2001318.
[8] W. L. Craig, On Guard: Defending Your Faith with Reason and Precision. David C Cook, 2010.
[9] M. Martin, The Cambridge Companion to Atheism. in The Cambridge companions. New York: Cambridge university press, 2007.
[10] J. Hare, “Religion and Morality,” in The Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy, Fall 2019., E. N. Zalta, Ed., Metaphysics Research Lab, Stanford University, 2019. Accessed: Dec. 30, 2023. [Online]. Available: [https://plato.stanford.edu/archives/fall2019/entries/religion-morality/](https://plato.stanford.edu/archives/fall2019/entries/religion-morality/)
[11] J. E. Hare, God’s Command. in Oxford studies in theological ethics. Oxford: Oxford university press, 2015.

description:
#apologetics #christianity 
In this video I'll talk a bit about some concerns I have with the way some people practice "apologetics" and why I think this 

You can also see @Randal_Rauser 's video, though I have a slightly different perspective on these topics: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EpCsvFOi3xI&t=829s

title: Are there things AI Can't Do?
description:
#ai #artificialintelligence #machinelearning #philosophy #chatgpt #mind #intelligence 

Note: This material is heavily inspired by the work of Robert Marks II, the first president of the IEEE Computational Intelligence Society.  I recommend consulting his work for more information.  I also recommend Martin Davis' incredible book "The Universal Computer;"  Davis had the same PhD advisor as Turing, Alanzo Church.

References:
[1] “Google AI defeats human Go champion,” BBC News, May 25, 2017. Accessed: Nov. 04, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-40042581
[2] A. Radford, K. Narasimhan, T. Salimans, and I. Sutskever, “Improving language understanding by generative pre-training,” OpenAI, 2018.
[3] R. Kurzweil, The Age of Spiritual Machines: When Computers Exceed Human Intelligence. Penguin, 2000.
[3] A. Kharpal, “Stephen Hawking says A.I. could be ‘worst event in the history of our civilization,’” CNBC. Accessed: Nov. 04, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://www.cnbc.com/2017/11/06/stephen-hawking-ai-could-be-worst-event-in-civilization.html
[5] H. A. Kissinger, “How the Enlightenment Ends,” The Atlantic, May 15, 2018. Accessed: Nov. 04, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2018/06/henry-kissinger-ai-could-mean-the-end-of-human-history/559124/

[9] A. M. Turing, “On Computable Numbers, with an Application to the Entscheidungsproblem,” Proceedings of the London Mathematical Society, vol. s2-42, no. 1, pp. 230–265, 1937, doi: 10.1112/plms/s2-42.1.230.
[10] R. J. Marks, “40. Will Intelligent Machines Rise Up and Overtake Humanity?,” in The Comprehensive Guide to Science and Faith: Exploring the Ultimate Questions About Life and the Cosmos, Eugene: Harvest House Publishers, 2021.
[11] T. Nagel, “11. What Is It Like to Be a Bat?,” in 11. What Is It Like to Be a Bat?, Harvard University Press, 2013, pp. 159–168. doi: 10.4159/harvard.9780674594623.c15.

[17] S. Bringsjord, P. Bello, and D. Ferrucci, “Creativity, the Turing Test, and the (Better) Lovelace Test,” in The Turing Test: The Elusive Standard of Artificial Intelligence, J. H. Moor, Ed., Dordrecht: Springer Netherlands, 2003, pp. 215–239. doi: 10.1007/978-94-010-0105-2_12.

title: ...but what is probability? what is chance?
description:
#statistics #philosophy #datascience #probability #chance #bayesian 

In this video, I'll explain what probability and chance are often meant to capture.  I'll talk about the differences between the Frequentist and Bayesian perspectives.

NOTE: There are two typos at 14:52.  The average or expected side length for cubes with a face area from 0 to 1 should be 2/3, and the average or expected side length of a cube with volume from 0 to 1 should be 3/4.  This doesn't change the argument but these are the correct values for those integrals.

References:
[1] E. T. Bell, The Development of Mathematics. Courier Corporation, 2012.

[2] B. De Finetti, A. Machì, A. F. M. Smith, and B. De Finetti, Theory of probability: a critical introductory treatment. Chichester, UK ; Hoboken, NJ: John Wiley & Sons, 2017.

Accessed: Jul. 18, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://plato.stanford.edu/archives/win2023/entries/probability-interpret/

title: 8 Critiques of Verificationism and Logical Positivism
description:
#philosophy #philosophyofreligion #philosophyofscience #theology #apologetics #science 
In this video, I'll talk about 8 big issues with Verificationism and Logical Positivism that eventually led to their demise in philosophy.

#science #theology #philosophy #philosophyofreligion #philosophyofscience #gravity #newton #issacnewton #history #historyofscience

title: Russell's Teapot
description:
#atheism  #theism #apologetics #philosophy #philosophyofreligion #epistemology 
In this video I'll explain what Russell's teapot is and four reasons why it is a poor analogy to belief in God
References
[1] R. Monk, Bertrand Russell: The Ghost of Madness, 1921-1970. New York: Free Press, 2000.
[2] S. James, “Collected Papers of Bertrand Russell, Volume 11: : Last Philosophical Testament 1943‐1968,” Reference Reviews vol. 11, no. 5, pp. 10–10, Jan. 1997, doi:10.1108/rr.1997.11.5.10.278

[4] M. Truzzi, “Zetetic Ruminatrons on Skepticism and Anomalies in Science,” Citeseer_ vol. 12–13, pp. 7–21, 1987.
[5] A. I. Goldman, “What is Justified Belief?,” in Justification and Knowledge: New Studies in Epistemology, G. Pappas, Ed., D. Reidel, 1979, pp. 1–25.
[6] T. Reid,  An Inquiry Into the Human Mind, 6th Ed. Bell & Bradfute, 1810.
[7] E. T. Bell, The Development of Mathematics. Courier Corporation, 2012.
[8] A. Hájek, “Interpretations of Probability,” in The Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy, Winter 2023., E. N. Zalta and U. Nodelman, Eds., Metaphysics Research Lab, Stanford University, 2023. Accessed: Jul. 18, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://plato.stanford.edu/archives/win2023/entries/probability-interpret/

title: Why is there something rather than nothing?
description:
#philosophy #theology #christianity #god #apologetics #leibniz #theism #reasoning #reason #catholic #islam
In this video, I'll talk about Gottfried Leibniz' and Thomas Aquinas' ideas around why something exists

title: Faith, Evidence, and Belief (What makes belief in God rational?)
description:
In this video, I'll talk about the rationality of theistic belief, which includes the idea of warrant and topics from reformed epistemology.

title: Atheism implies Moral Nihilism.  Here's why
description:
In this video, I'll explain why atheism in particular, and naturalism more generally, both imply moral nihilism.

title: 10 Christian Responses to the Problem of Evil
description:
#christianity #theism #philosophyofreligion #philosophy #theism 
In this video, I'll explain 10 of the most popular Christian responses to the problem of evil.  These are called theodicies, which are explanations as to why God allows evil to exist.

See also: https://philpapers.org/rec/MAYTIY

title: How Bayes' Theorem Started as an Argument for Christianity
description:
#mathematics #statistics #christianity #apologetics #philosophy #bayestheorem 
In this video I'll explain how Bayes' Theorem started as an argument for Christianity, in particular an argument for the resurrection of Jesus as a response to David Hume's argument against miracles.

[1] David Hume - An Enquiry Concerning Human Understanding (ECHU) (1748)

title: How can God create time "before" time?
description:
#theism #christianity #god #philosophy 
In this video, I'll explain why I used to think the idea of God was incoherent because it presupposed the existence of time.  I had mistakenly thought creation or causation required time.

References:
[1] WLC - Time and Eternity
[2] Richard Swinburne - Is There a God?

[6] CS Lewis - Miracles

title: Aquinas' First Way Explained (Argument from Motion)
description:
#philosophy #christianity #theism #apologetics #thomas #thomasaquinas 
In this video, I'll explain Thomas Aquinas' First Way, which is a proof for the existence of God based on motion/change.  Following Aristotle, Aqiunas deduced that there must be a "first mover" or "unmoved mover" that caused everything in the universe.

title: Discussing Metaethics with Dr. Lance Bush
Atheism is a lack of belief?
description:
In this video I'll talk about the two different definitions of atheism, and why many philosophers of religion prefer the "disbelief" rather than the "unbelief" version of it.  See this article:
https://plato.stanford.edu/entries/atheism-agnosticism/

#atheism #christian #christianity #skepticism #philosophy #philosophyofreligion

title: There are no airtight arguments for the existence of God
description:
In this video, I'll talk about the "fact" that there are no airtight arguments for the existence of God.  Perhaps surprisingly, I actually agree with this claim, but I want to point out how it can be used in manipulative way, in particular by those with a flawed, question begging, and self-defeating epistemology.

#theism #christian #christianity #god #apologetics

description:
#philosophy #morality #christianity #theism

description:
#nietzsche #philosophy #sociology #christianity

title: Atheist (and Naturalist) Morality and Special Pleading
description:
In this video, I'll explain why I often see atheistic and naturalistic forms of morality or moral realism committing the fallacy of special pleading.  I am making this video because I really want to know why it is that so many atheists and naturalists believe in Moral Realism.  I find this especially confusing given the work of atheistic scholars like Michael Ruse, Sharon Street, Jonathan Haidt, Richard Joyce, J.L. Mackie who make a compelling case for moral nihilism under naturalism.

What matters of course is having a consistent and coherent belief structure.  I'd be curious to hear your reasons in the comments - I promise I'll be respectful and open-minded.

#theism #christianity #atheism #morality #naturalism

title: Why (I think) the argument from Religious Evil Fails...
description:
In this video, I'll explain why the argument from religious evil fails, and show how Alvin Plantinga' "Free Will Defense" also applies to the argument from religious evil.  You can find the paper here
https://www.jstor.org/stable/43670543
Also it shows up as argument 196 from Ex-Apologist's list of arguments for atheism: http://exapologist.blogspot.com/2022/06/120-or-so-arguments-for-atheism.html
#christianity #theology #theism #god

title: Why I am not a naturalist...
description:
In this video, I'll explain, why I am not a naturalist

#theism #christianity #philosophy #naturalism

title: Alvin Plantinga's Ontological Argument (Arguments for Christianity)
description:
I have a SubStack, read more here: https://thinkingchristian.substack.com

In this video, I'll talk about Alvin Plantinga's Ontological Argument for the existence of God.  This is a very different argument than the ones by St Anselm, for instance, and it rests on the idea of possible worlds which I will try to explain briefly and their relationship to modal logic.
References:
[1] https://plato.stanford.edu/entries/logic-modal/
[2] Alvin Plantinga - The Ontological Argument (1965)
[3] WLC - Reasonable Faith
#christianity #theism #god #philosophy #theology

title: Crash Course Philosophy Misrepresents St Anselm
description:
In this video, I'll explain how @crashcourse Philosophy ends up mistaking and misrepresenting St Anselm's Ontological Argument.  Despite the fact that this is the most viewed video on St Anselm's Ontological Argument, it misunderstands the argument's resting on Platonic Metaphysics, which scholars like Charlesworth, Norman Malcom, and Richard Brecher all point out.

While it is fine to say you are not convinced, my issue is Crash Course Philosophy
#christianity #philosophy #philosophyofreligion #theism #atheism

title: St. Anselm's Ontological Argument (Arguments for Christianity)
description:
I have a SubStack: Read more here: https://thinkingchristian.substack.com

In this video, I'll talk about St Anselm's Ontological Argument for the existence of God.  I think this is one of the most widely misunderstood arguments in philosophy, because it rests on Platonic Metaphysics (which is largely lost in our society today, which is more Aristotelian thanks to Thomas Aquinas).

References:
[1] https://iep.utm.edu/anselm-ontological-argument/#:~:text=More%20formally%2C%20the%20argument%20is,that%20does%20not%20necessarily%20exist.
[2] Richard Brecher - “Greatness' in Anselm's Ontological Argument” (1974) link: https://www.jstor.org/stable/2217714#:~:text='better'%20or%20'more%20perfect,Anselm's%20argument%20for%20his%20existence.
#christianity #theism #god #philosophy #theology

title: Arguments Aren't Evidence?
description: In this video, I want to explore the idea that "arguments aren't evidence."  I've heard some skeptics, including @DeconvertedMan , argue that arguments are not evidence.  Either this is categorically wrong, or (perhaps more likely) I am misunderstanding what the claim is.

title: Craig's Conceptual Argument (Arguments for Christianity)
description:
In this video, I'll talk about William Lane Craig's sketch of a conceptual argument for the existence of God, as well as my formulation of this argument.
References:
[1] WLC - Reasonable Faith
[2] Alvin Plantinga - Two Dozen (Or So) Theistic Arguments

title: Paul's Teleological Argument (Arguments for Christianity)
description:
In this video, I'll talk about my teleological moral argument for the existence of God.
This argument rests on the work of philosophers like Alasdair MacIntyre, Aristotle, and Thomas Aquinas (it is based in part on Analytic Thomism)
#christianity #theism #god #philosophy #theology

Craig's Moral Argument (Arguments for Christianity)

title: Thinking Christian Live Stream
John Loftus's "Outsider Test of Faith"
description:
#christianity #god #theism #por #philosophy #philosophyofreligion #religion 
In this video, I'll respond to Philosopher John Loftus's "Outsider Test of Faith" or his OTF.  I'll explain why, despite initially finding it compelling, I eventually came to realize it rested on several assumptions that require justification.  While I do not think the argument succeeds as a general argument against religious belief, I do think Loftus's presentation brings up some important points about religious and philosophical pluralism which I attempt to explore in this video.

title: Anti-Intellectualism in New Atheism...
description:
In this video, I want to talk about the problem of anti-intellecutalism in some Atheist circles (esoecially with regard to New Atheism), address the problem, and hopefully allow people to move forward.

description:
In this video, I'll explain the argument from geographic distribution/diversity and why it counts as an argument against the existence of God.  This idea comes from a video from @CosmicSkeptic which was originally a debate between him and Jonathan McLatchie in May 2022

description:
In this video, I'll talk about William Lane Craig's version of the Kalam Cosmological Argument.  According to Michael Martin, the cosmological arguments presented by Craig, Bruce Reichenbach, and Richard Swinburne are "among the most sophisticated and well argued in contemporary theological philosophy."
#christianity #theism #god #philosophy #theology

title: A Nuanced Take on Christian Nationalism?
description:

title: Simulation Theology 101: 3 - Incarnation
description:
In this new series, I want to talk about Simulation Theology (Sim Theology) and some of the big questions it asks.

In this video, I'll explain how our experience with simulated worlds and virtual worlds can offer an interesting analogy on incarnation, including Christology.  Remember that these are simply analogies, not necessarily an explanation of what happened.  Still, I hope this provides some interesting ways to think about incarnation and miracles.

#christianity #philosophy #god #theology

description:
In this video, I'll talk about about how the philosophy of Martin Heidegger, one of the most influential philosophers of the 20th century, can help us understand Christianity and God's relationship to man.

title: The Simulation Theory Argument for the Existence of God
description:
An argument from the likes of David Chalmers and myself.  I don't think this will necessarily convince anyone that "God Exists" as much as being a useful exploration of probabilities and an interesting direction into "Simulation Theology" or "Sim Theology"

title: My Issue with "Evolution"...
description:
In this video, I want to talk about my issue with "Evolution."  My issue is not with Darwinian natural selection or modern genetics, in fact I think these things have been empirically demonstrated.  Rather my issue is the sufficiency of natural selection and modern genetic theory alone at describing life.  This issue intersects with philosophy of science, religion, and more.
References:
[1] https://plato.stanford.edu/entries/scientific-realism/
[2] Lewis et. Al - The relationship between intelligence and multiple domains of religious belief: Evidence from a large adult US sample
[3] David Hume - An Enquiry concerning Human Understanding (1748)
[4] Karl Popper - The Logic of Scientific Discovery (1959)
[5] https://plato.stanford.edu/entries/induction-problem/

#philosophyofscience

title: Do Extraordinary Claims Require Extraordinary Evidence?
description:
In this video, I want to ask whether Extraordinary Claims Require Extraordinary Evidence.
This is not really a response to @EmersonGreen  as much as an exploration of a few ideas in his video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ULIRA7Lcfe8&pp=ygUNZW1lcnNvbiBncmVlbg%3D%3D

In other words, I agree that it seems we need more evidence for claims that are more "wild," however there is a subjectivity when it comes to our own beliefs that is worth acknowleding.

title: Theism vs Atheism - An Important Difference
description:
In this video, I want to talk about a key difference between theism and atheism, which has to do with the precedence of mind and matter.

#theism #atheism #christianity

title: Anti-Intellectualism in Christianity
description:
In this video, I want to talk about the problem of anti-intellecutalism in some Christian circles, address the problem, and hopefully allow people to move forward.

[1] Mark Noll - Scandal of the Evangelical Mind
[2] Tobin et. Al - Profiles of the American University Vol. 2
[3] Gunn - Religious Discrimination in the Selection of Medical Students: A Case Study
[4] Yancey - Compromising Scholarship
[5] Tapia - Losing the Precious Few
[6] Lewis et. Al - The relationship between intelligence and multiple domains of religious belief: Evidence from a large adult US sample
 #jesus #scholarship #christianity

description:
In this video, I want to explore the question of whether there can be "Good" without the existence of "God"

title: Is there "No Evidence for God"?
description:
In this video, I'll go through and address the question of whether there is "no evidence for God" as some claim, (and what the atheist needs to provide to demonstrate this claim)
Here's a link to Plantinga's paper:
Alvin Plantinga - Two Dozen or So Theistic Arguments
https://nemoslibrary.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/plantinga-alvin-two_dozen_or_so_theistic_arguments.pdf

EDIT: For what is probably an even better treatment on this topic, check out @EmersonGreen 's video I found (after uploading this): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4dalQu-vdMU&t=657s

title: Pseudoskepticism ("Bogus Skepticism")
description:
In this video, I'll explain some of the issues around pseudoskepticism and why many skeptics or former skeptics have issues with mainstream "skepticism" as a social identity.  

References:
[1] Truzzi - Zetetic Ruminations on Skepticism and Anomalies in Science (1987)
[2] Quite and Ullian - Web of Belief (1978)
[3] Bond - Why I Am No Longer a Skeptic
[4] Weinberg - Against Philosophy
[5] Hyslop - The Bias of Skepticism (1909)

#skeptic #skepticism

title: Debunking David Hume’s Argument Against Miracles
description:
In this video, I'll go over issues with David Hume's argument Against Miracles in "An Enquiry Concerning Human Understanding."  By "debunking,"
 I mean pointing out issues in its current fomulation.  As a result, it can be reformulated in a stronger way, but it needs to take into account developments in thought since then.  My issues with Hume's argument are as follows:
1.  Hume's argument begs the question
2.  Hume's argument is inconsistent with Hume's own skepticism
3.  Hume's argument "proves too much"
4.  Hume was ignorant of modern science (due to his place in history), which severly undermine his argument
5.  Hume was ignorant of modern probability theory (including Bayesian statistics and Bayesian epsitemology), developed in response *to* his argument against miracles

Despite these problems, I have a great respect for Hume and do think his argument is worth considering and discussing.  However, as atheist Peter Millican argues, it needs to be reformulated.  A thank you to @TestifyApologetics for sugggesting Devett and Habermas's book from one of his YouTube videos (It is avaliable on Audible)

[1] Klibansky and Mossner - New Letters p234
[2] Devett and Habermas - In Defense of Miracles: A Comprehensive Case for God's Action in History
[3] Hume - An Enquiry Concerning Human Understanding
[4] Earman - Hume’s Abject Failure
[5] Millican - Earman on Hume on Mircales
[6] Lewis - On Miracles
[7] Cramer - Miracles and David Hume
[8] Flew - There Is A God
#philosophy  #christianity #miracle #miracles

title: Some Issues with Satanism (Satanic Temple/TST)
description:
In this video, I'll talk about some issues I have with the Satanic Temple/TST.  These include legal, definitional, and moral issues that come from an internal critique.

#christianity #jesus #satan

title: I'm tired of Anti Catholicism (And I'm a Protestant)
description:
Int his video, I'll explain why, as a Protestant, I'm sick and tired of hearing poor, bad-faith attacks against Catholicism.  

I have a SubStack, read more here: https://thinkingchristian.substack.com

Great reading:
Rodney Stark - Bearing False Witness
Fr Boyle - Tattoos on the Heart
Copleston - A History of Philosophy
Anything by Alasdair MacIntyre (After Virtue in particular)
Socrates Meets Jesus by Peter Kreeft

#catholic #christianity

title: A response to MajestyOfReason (Responding to Trent Horn (Responding to RR))
description:
In this video, I'll give a response to @MajestyofReason 's response to @TheCounselofTrent  (who was originally responding to @rationalityrules )
Have a great day and thanks for stopping by.  If Trent or Joe are watching, thanks and also feel free to keep the train going.

#theism #christianity #moralphilosophy

title: Responding to Wes Morriston's "Infinite Praises" Argument
description:
In this video, I want to give a response to Wes Morriston's "Praises Argument" given in his 2012 Paper "Beginningless Past and Endless Future" https://www.pdcnet.org/pdc/bvdb.nsf/showopenaccess?open&repid=8525737F0058138F&docid=4276D1307AA2262EC1257AC40061CF62&solarid=faithphil_2012_0029_0004_0444_0450. This argument is used by others such as James Fodor in his book Unreasonable Faith.  @ReasonableFaithOrg William Lane Craig's response is not only adequate, but brings out the question-begging nature of some formulations of this as an argument for an infinite collection/set.

#christianity #mathematics #god

title: Understanding the Burden of Proof (For Dummies)
description:
In this video, I want to explain the burden of proof and how it relates to good argumentation.

#philosophy #christianity

title: No Actual Infinite from Successive Addition [Hilbert's Balls]
description:
In this video, I want to explain why you cannot have an actual infinite from successive addition.  This is Craig's premise 5 of the KCA but I do not plan on defending the Kalam in this video, rather I want to give an illustration (thanks to Dr. Wildberger) of why you cannot do this.

#mathematics  #infinity

title: Response to MajestyofReason: Is an Actual Infinity Absurd?
description:
In this video, I want to give a brief sketch of a possible response to @MajestyofReason's videos on infinity and the Kalam cosmological argument.   I don't necessarily hold that actual infinities are not actually realizable, but I very heavily lean in that direction and want to explain some of those reasons in this video.
#maths #mathematics #infinity

title: Should You Trust Science Less?
description:
In this video, I want to ask the question whether you should trust science less, more, or in a more nuanced way.  It is about correctly orienting the strength of our belief towards theories we have better evidence for.

#science #philosophy #philosophyofscience #epistemology

title: Evaluating GMS's reasons for not being a Christian
description:
In this video, I'll respond to @GeneticallyModifiedSkeptic 's reasons for, despite loving Jesus, not being a Christian or identifying as such.  Some are solid reasons, while others are based on a lack of scholarship.  I don't think this will change his mind (and I don't intend or desire to), but hopefully continue the conversation in a healthy way.

Here is a link to my paper: https://philpapers.org/rec/PAUCTG-2
#skeptic #jesus #christian #christianity

title: The Question Secular Humanism Can't Answer...
description:
#secularism #secularhumanism #humanism 
In this video, I'll explain the main question Secular Humanism can't answer, and why it may be forever unable to answer such a question (under its naturalistic assumptions):
Link to my paper: https://philpapers.org/rec/PAUCTG-2
Ohter resources:
G.E.M. Anscombe - Modern Moral Philosophy https://sites.pitt.edu/~mthompso/readings/mmp.pdf
Alasdair MacIntyre - After Virtue
Richard Joyce - The Myth of Morality, The Evolution of Morality
Kai Neilson - Ethics Without God
JL Mackie - Ethics: Inventing Right and Wrong

title: The Problem with (New) Atheism...
description:
In this video, I want to explain what I find are the issues with (New) Atheism (not as a philosophical position, but as an identity)

Here's a blog post going into more detail here: https://www.thinkingchristianblog.com/post/the-issue-with-new-atheism

title: In defense of Jonathan Haidt
description: In this video, I'll explain why I deeply respect social psychologist Jonathan Haidt.

title: Bayesian Necessity Argument for the Existence of God
description: I admit this argument is a bit goofy, but I'll explain why I think it is still useful and worth listening to.  All you need to know is Bayes' Theorem.

title: On the Incompatibility of Naturalism and Moral Realism
description: In this video, I want to explain why I think Moral Realism and naturalism are incompatible.  In doing so, I'll draw upon Alasdair MacIntyre's work "After Virtue" as well as EDAs from contemporary metaethicists like Richard Joyce and classical skeptical moral theory like J.L. Mackie.

title: The Virtues of Christian Scholarship [Argue like a Christian]
description: In this video, I’m going to explain what I call the virtues of Christian scholarship.  I’ll go through the areas and ideas I found in the Bible that helped me with my own research.
